alert.note: Alert for Del Norte Interior (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued November 04 at 2:11PM PDT until November 04 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE SMITH RIVER COMPLEX BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall continue to be possible over the Smith River Complex burn scar. * WHERE...A portion of northwest California, including the following area, Del Norte Interior. * WHEN...Until 8 PM PDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall rates may cause flash flooding due to debris flows. Residents near the Smith River Complex burn scar should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. Heavy rainfall could trigger debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting heavy rainfall over the burn scar, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
